Node.definition: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which a person behaves in an unassuming or moderate way, especially relative to one's abilities, appearing less important than reality suggests
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= process by which humans or animals stop living

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to make someone else's way straight; = causative action by which deities cause the actions and endeavors of humans to be prosperous and successful
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children|= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power|read אָוֶן (אָוֶן)

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= causative action by which deities bring humans out of a dangerous situation
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= causative action by which deities bring humans out of a dangerous situation
literally: goodness; = state in which people go through a time of relative prosperity
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right

literally: to be, become high; hence: = processs by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
= information that is known by humans or deities but kept hidden from others

Node.gloss: to be faithful|to be reliable|to be trustworthy|to be true
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event

Node.gloss: to suffer (harm)|to go badly|to be in trouble
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience difficulty or hardship as a consequence for wrong or harmful behavior

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= causative action by which humans or deities bring misfortune and distress on human ◄ by one's behavior, whether or not intentionally
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals
literally: to make (possessions); hence: = action by which humans obtain possessions
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions
= state in which a pattern of behavior is a product of faithfulness and is therefore in conformity with God's law

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to be crooked (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: hand to hand; hence: = state in which the truth of a statement is confirmed
literally: hand to hand; hence: = state in which the truth of a statement is confirmed

Node.gloss: to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: = state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= group of people that consider themselves descendants of one single ancestor|= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as offspring of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= ring; ◄ made out of silver or gold; ► worn for personal adornment, either in the ear or in the nose
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils

= hairy mammal with hoofs, brown or gray in color; non ruminant and omnivorous; ◄ |iSus scropus|i*, wild or domesticated land animal; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ regarded as an ugly, filthy, and destructive animal and often associated with pagan rituals
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye
literally: (good) taste; hence: = state in which humans act with good judgment
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities
= causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= objects, ◄ presented as gift by one person to another

Node.gloss: to be made fat > to prosper
Node.definition: = process by which humans are caused to prosper in life, described as becoming fat

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative process by which humans are made to prosper in life, ◄ described as being refreshed with rainwater
collective: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as the main ingredient for bread and related food products; ≈ regarded as an essential condition for life

= causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= causative action by which humans make an effort to ensure that a certain event takes place
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status

= one of the expanded, usually green structures growing from the stem of a plant; ► providing shade; ≈ associated with life when green, but known to wither when disconnected from the plant and therefore also denoting the fragility of life
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities bring misfortune and distress on human ◄ by one's behavior, whether or not intentionally
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
